alert.note: Alert for Bladen; Robeson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 6:15PM EST until December 17 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast North Carolina, including the following counties, Bladen and Robeson. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 PM EST, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lumberton, Elizabethtown, Red Springs, Rowan, Pembroke, Fairmont, Maxton, St. Pauls, Bladenboro, Rowland, Sandyfield, Boardman, Smiths, Butters, Howellsville, Bladen Community College, Tolarsville, Hestertown, Barker Ten Mile and Robeson Community College. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
